messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: INCIDENT REPORT: #L-7832-MP DATE: 11/15/32  A high-profile art theft was reported from the renowned Museo del Arte Moderno. Several priceless paintings from the early 20th century were stolen in a meticulously planned heist. The theft seems to have occurred during the museum's renovation period, making use of the blind spots left by displaced security cameras.  LAW ENFORCEMENT RESPONSE:  LEAD DETECTIVE: Detective A. B. C. Harper, an expert in art theft, was assigned to helm the investigation and piece together the clues. FORENSIC ANALYSIS: Detective D. E. F. Rivera, with a deep understanding of forensic art analysis, is working on identifying any traceable marks on the remaining pieces and the crime scene. SECURITY LIAISON: Captain G. H. I. Faulkner has been coordinating with the museum's security team, reviewing camera feeds, and identifying any potential lapses. PATROL: Patrol Officer J. K. L. Sanderson and Patrol Officer M. N. O. Chen were the first responders, ensuring the security of the crime scene and gathering initial witness statements. INFORMANT NETWORK: Detective P. Q. R. Jensen has been activating his network of informants to gain any underground intelligence on the stolen artwork. The theft has left the art community in shock, and the recovery of these invaluable pieces is of paramount importance. The department is putting forth all available resources to resolve the case and return the stolen masterpieces.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Detective A. B. C. Harper  
Officer Context: Detective Harper is leading the investigation into the art theft.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective D. E. F. Rivera  
Officer Context: Detective Rivera is focusing on forensic art analysis for the case.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Captain G. H. I. Faulkner  
Officer Context: Captain Faulkner is coordinating with the museum's security team to review the evidence.  
Officer Role: Captain 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer J. K. L. Sanderson  
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Sanderson was among the first to arrive at the scene.  
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer M. N. O. Chen  
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Chen assisted in securing the crime scene initially.  
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Detective P. Q. R. Jensen  
Officer Context: Detective Jensen is seeking underground intelligence regarding the stolen artwork.  
Officer Role: Detective
